slides.title: ISLAMIC FINANCIAL RIGHTS
slides.subtitle: (Review from Course 1)

nafaqa.title: NAFAQA (Maintenance) - OBLIGATION:
nafaqa.emphasis: This is not optional. This is a religious and legal obligation.

mahru.title: MAHRU (Dowry):
items: She can claim in court if not paid

wifeRights.heading: WIFE'S FINANCIAL RIGHTS:
wifeRights.principle: HER MONEY IS HERS - ABSOLUTE RIGHT:
items: NOT obligated to spend on household
can: She CANNOT be forced to contribute.
abilities: Spend her money as she wishes
Refuse to give money to husband

slides.legal: This is Islamic law. This is Maldivian law. This is your right.
slides.important: These are MINIMUM requirements. A good marriage involves MORE than minimum.
baseline: Both can agree to different arrangements
But HER RIGHTS cannot be taken away

slides.title: HOW WILL YOU MANAGE MONEY?
slides.introduction: In Course 2, you chose your system. Now let's understand how to make it work.

systems.title: FULLY JOINT
description: All income goes into one account
All expenses paid from one account
cons: Can cause conflict over spending differences

systems.title: FULLY SEPARATE
description: Divide expenses clearly (50/50 or by income ratio)
cons: Can feel like roommates, not spouses
Need clear agreements on who pays what

systems.title: HYBRID (Most Common)
pros: Respects Islamic rights while building partnership
cons: Need clear agreements on contribution amounts

remember.warning: Financial stress destroys marriages. Living beyond your means creates debt and arguments.

slides.title: EMERGENCY FUND: YOUR SAFETY NET

definition.heading: What is Emergency Fund?
definition.text: Money saved ONLY for unexpected expenses:

importance.heading: Why You NEED It:
withoutFund: Must borrow money when crisis hits (creating debt + interest)

howMuch.heading: HOW MUCH TO SAVE?
encouragement: This sounds like a lot, but:

startSmall.heading: START SMALL:
startSmall.approach: Don't wait until you can save big amounts. Start with what you can:

steps.title: SET IT AS PRIORITY
steps.detail: Pay yourself first - put money in savings BEFORE spending on other things

steps.title: AUTOMATE IF POSSIBLE
steps.detail: Set up automatic transfer to savings account

steps.title: REDUCE ONE EXPENSE
steps.detail: Find one thing to cut. Put that money in emergency fund

whereToKeep.heading: WHERE TO KEEP IT:
items: Both partners know where it is
Both partners agree not to touch except emergency

defineEmergency.heading: DEFINE 'EMERGENCY':
not: Sale you don't want to miss
New phone because you want one

slides.closing: Having emergency fund = Financial security. Start building yours TODAY.

slides.title: HOW TO SAVE (Even with Low Income)

truth.heading: TRUTH: Saving is hard when income is low.
truth.context: If most of your income goes to: Rent, Food, Basic necessities

strategies.title: PAY YOURSELF FIRST
strategies.reality: Reality: If you earn 8,000 MVR and rent is 5,000 MVR, saving 10% (800 MVR) is very hard.
strategies.action: Put it aside BEFORE spending on anything else.

strategies.title: AUTOMATE IF POSSIBLE
ifBankAllows: You won't miss what you don't see

strategies.title: REDUCE ONE THING
findOne: Make coffee at home instead of buying
Walk instead of speedboat once a week

mindset.heading: IMPORTANT MINDSET:
dontCompare: People who can save 5,000 MVR monthly
mantras: Small amounts add up over time.

example.heading: If you can only save 20 MVR this month:

encouragement: Poverty is not a moral failing.
Trying to save despite poverty is admirable.

slides.title: ⚠️ FINANCIAL ABUSE IS DOMESTIC VIOLENCE ⚠️
slides.definition: Financial abuse = Using money to control partner
slides.legal: This is ILLEGAL under Domestic Violence Prevention Act.

warningSigns.heading: WARNING SIGNS:
items: Takes your bank card/ID without permission
Demands access to YOUR accounts but hides theirs
Gives you 'allowance' from YOUR own money
Spends family money on self while family suffers
Takes loans in your name without permission
Refuses to contribute to household (husband's obligation)
Makes you beg for basic needs
Controls ALL money decisions without input
Sabotages your job (makes you late, harasses you at work)

slides.emphasis: EVEN ONE of these signs is abuse.

examples.scenario: Mariyam earns 15,000 MVR as nurse. Husband took her bank card 'for safekeeping.' Now gives her 2,000 MVR monthly for 'personal use.' Won't show her where the 13,000 MVR goes. He bought new phone for himself. She can't help her family despite earning good salary.
Ahmed's wife controls all money. He works and earns salary. She takes it all. He has to ask for bus fare. She ridicules him for wanting money. He feels trapped.
examples.verdict: THIS IS FINANCIAL ABUSE. (Yes, can happen to men too)

steps.title: KNOW YOUR RIGHTS
items: Husband: You have right to your earnings too
Both: Financial transparency is your right

steps.title: PROTECT YOUR MONEY
ifPossible: Open account in YOUR name only

steps.title: KEEP YOUR ID CARD
items: Never give it to partner to 'keep safe'
You need it to access services

steps.title: SEEK HELP
steps.message: This is not your fault. This is serious abuse.

closing: If it's happening to you: YOU DESERVE BETTER. GET HELP.

slides.title: RIGHTS IN DIVORCE - PRACTICAL INFORMATION
slides.introduction: Nobody wants to think about this, but knowing rights protects you.

duringIddah.heading: DURING IDDAH (3 months after divorce):
wifeRights: HOUSING: Husband provides or pays rent
Keep all property in her name

afterIddah.heading: AFTER IDDAH:
rights: Get her share of jointly-owned property
Cannot be evicted from Hiya flat in her name

childSupport.heading: CHILD SUPPORT:
childSupport.obligation: Father MUST support children until: 18 for girls, Earning age for boys
childSupport.determination: Court determines amount based on: Father's income, Child's needs

realityCheck.heading: REALITY CHECK:
hardTruth: Many fathers don't pay despite court orders
Plan as if you'll support children alone

slides.title: PROTECTING YOURSELF FINANCIALLY
slides.introduction: This is NOT distrust. It's being wise.

beforeMarriage.heading: Before Marriage:
items: Keep copies of all important documents
Have small emergency fund in your name
Keep your ID card always with you

duringMarriage.heading: During Marriage:
items: Keep some savings partner doesn't control

situation: When married Ahmed 1 year ago, he suggested she give him her bank card 'for safekeeping'
Now: She asks for money when needs anything
He gives her 2,000 MVR/month for 'personal use'
He says he's 'saving' the rest but won't show her
Her family needs help but he says 'we can't afford it'
He bought new phone for himself last month
She doesn't know what happens to her salary

questions.question: What signs of financial abuse do you see?
questions.sampleAnswer: Taking her bank card and controlling access, Giving 'allowance' from HER money (13,000 missing), Won't show her the 'savings', She can't help her family, He spends on himself freely, She has no access to her own earnings

questions.question: What should Mariyam do?
options: Accept this arrangement since he's 'saving' the money
Demand her bank card back, report to Gender Ministry if he refuses, seek legal advice
Just be grateful he gives her 2,000 MVR
Ask her family to talk to him
questions.explanation: Correct: Demand her bank card back (it's HER money), Open new account if he refuses, Report to Gender Ministry 1421, Seek legal advice, Consider protection order

feedback.allCorrect: Excellent! You can recognize financial abuse and know the appropriate response.
feedback.someCorrect: Review the signs of financial abuse. Mariyam's situation is clearly abusive and requires immediate action.
feedback.needsReview: This is a clear case of financial abuse. Please review the material on financial abuse warning signs.
